column4: would anyone please be able to assist me with getting Suspend/Hibernate working on my laptop.  I haven't been able to do it since the day I installed Ubuntu.
did you install using windows?
what do you mean?
is ubuntu the only installation you have on your computer? or is it a dual boot. if so, how did you install it?
I had windows XP at first, and then I completely erased it and now I only have Ubuntu
yes
ubuntu only
what happens when you try to suspend and hibernate?
have you tried using USWSUSP?

either it goes to a black screen and I see nothing and it just stays there.  OR it appears to work, the screen turns off and fans stop moving ect.. but when I resume then it stays at the black screen again
also, pressing ctrl+alt+backspace does nothing.  I have to do a hard reboot.
I have tried uswsusp, but I got an error when it finished installing and ran the setup... or whatever it's called
i'm out of ideas
thanks for you help
i had the same problem... i had to fix it by a fresh install
hope you don't have to go that far
the error said something about not having a valid swap, somthin like that
do you have a swap disk?
ya, that's what's so weird
it's not a separate disk, but it's on a separate partition.
yeah i gotcha. strange...

ok here's the exact error: "The swap file or partition that was found in uswsusp's configuration file is not active. In most cases this means userspace software suspend will not work for you and you will need to choose (or let uswsusp choose) another swap space. In some corner cases however, this can be what you want.  Continue without a valid swap space?"
